Utility Vehicles and Other Light Trucks

abstract.p: Larry Solway letter contends that as buyers have switched from cars to light trucks, fuel economy has declined, increasing nation's dependence on imported oil and increasing emissions of gases that many scientists have linked to global warming

block.p: A Sept. 15 Business Day article describes how car companies are promoting high-mileage light-truck versions of small cars in order to sell more high-consumption sport utility vehicles, since ''surveys show that with gasoline prices low, consumers care very little about fuel economy.'' However, ''as buyers have switched from cars to light trucks, fuel economy has declined, increasing the nation's dependence on imported oil and increasing emissions of gases that many scientists have linked to global warming.''

However, ''as buyers have switched from cars to light trucks, fuel economy has declined, increasing the nation's dependence on imported oil and increasing emissions of gases that many scientists have linked to global warming.''

Although I doubt there will be a sudden epiphany among S.U.V. enthusiasts over the dangers of global warming, surely they will listen to the warning about dependence on foreign oil. The American economy, however buoyant, is not bulletproof. The unlimited joys of the marketplace really do have limits, and we are reaching them.
